node.title: 'We don't know a lot about it': Health bosses monitoring Omicron outbreak as new travel ban comes into force
node.description: Effective immediately, non-Australian citizens who have been to nineÂ countries, including South Africa, cannot enter Australia.
node.content:
["The federal government has announced travel bans and new quarantine rules amid concerns about the new Omicron COVID-19 variant circulating in southern Africa.", "Effective immediately, non-Australian citizens who have been to the nine\u00a0countries, including South Africa, where Omicron has been detected cannot enter Australia.", "The nine countries are South Africa, Namibia, Zimbabwe, Botswana, Lesotho, Eswatini, The Seychelles, Malawi and Mozambique.", "Australian citizens and their dependents who have been to the countries over the past 14 days will need to enter two\u00a0weeks' supervised quarantine.", "Additionally, anyone who has already arrived in Australia from one\u00a0of the countries must isolate for 14 days.", "Australia has also suspended all flights to and from the affected countries.", "Health Minister Greg Hunt said there were no known cases of Omicron in Australia.", "But he warned the measures may be strengthened if\u00a0the situation changed.", "\"Things are still being monitored in relation to this particular variant,\" Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly said.", "\"We do know that it does contain a large number of mutations. It is quite different to previous variants that we have been watching.", "\"But at this point, other than understanding that it is transmissible between humans and is transmitting particularly in South Africa but also in those surrounding countries, we do not, at this point, have any clear indication that it is more severe, or any definite indication of issues in relation to the vaccine.", "\"We don't know a lot about it, to be honest,\" he added.", "Dozens of countries have closed their borders to South Africa and its neighbouring countries, where the variant was first found.", "Overnight, the\u00a0World Health Organization\u00a0called for calm, as scientists said it could take weeks to fully understand the variant's mutations and whether existing vaccines and treatments will work against it.", "More to\u00a0come\u00a0", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
